posts.content:
The importance of turning your website into a PWA is that it gives your website the right vitamins across several platforms. Your website can be viewed as if it was installed on your mobile device or a computer(Add-to-Home-Screen feature).

REQUIREMENTS

Turning your website into a PWA must meet some requirements. Those requirements are listed below

  • Your website must be secured - HTTPS
  • Your website must be responsive
  • Use an Updated Chrome Browser
  • manifest.json and service-worker.js file must be in your root folder (scroll down to see how to create the manifest.json and service-worker.js file)
  • Your website must be able to load offline( I`ll tell you how to do that in this article)

Once you meet the above requirements, you are ready to go!

SETUP YOUR manifest.json file

create a new file and name it manifest.json. This file tells your browser the details it needs about your PWA. Copy and paste the following codes to your manifest.json file;

{
  "short_name": "Paradise Model School",
  "name": "Paradise Model School",
  "description": "Paradise Model School",
  "lang": "en",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "img/icon.png",
      "sizes": "144x144",
      "type": "image/png"
    }
  ],
  "start_url": "/?utm_source=homescreen",
  "background_color": "#ffffff",
  "theme_color": "#000000",
  "display": "standalone",
  "related_applications": [{
    "platform": "web",
    "url": "https://paradisemodelschool.com.ng/"
  }]
}

Replace the short_name, name, description, url, background_color, theme_color and icons with your choice.

Note that the image size must be exactly 144px. If not, you`ll need to resize that image

CREATE YOUR service-worker.js file

Create a new file and name it service-worker.js. The service-worker.js file makes your website available offline. Copy and paste the following codes to your file

var CACHE_NAME = 'pwgen-cache-v1';
var urlsToCache = [
    'service-worker.js',
    'manifest.json',
    'css/style.css',
    'js/main.js',
    'img/icon.png'
];
console.log('loading sw');

self.addEventListener('install', function(event) {
    // Perform install steps
    console.log('installing sw');
    event.waitUntil(
        caches.open(CACHE_NAME)
            .then(function(cache) {
                console.log('Opened cache');
                var x = cache.addAll(urlsToCache);
                console.log('cache added');
                return x;
            })
    );
});

self.addEventListener('fetch', function(event) {
    event.respondWith(
        caches.match(event.request)
            .then(function(response) {
                    // Cache hit - return response
                    if (response) {
                        return response;
                    }
                    return fetch(event.request);
                }
            )
    );
});

Change the
'service-worker.js', 'manifest.json', 'css/style.css', 'js/main.js', 'img/icon.png' to what you have in your file system so as to make your website available offline.

LAST STEP

Head straight into your index file or your home file and add this code after your <head> tag

<meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="description" content="Paradise Model School website">
    <meta name="keywords" content="Paradise Model School, School">
    <meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
    <meta content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=0' name='viewport' />
    <meta name="theme-color" content="#000000">

make sure you change any important details to yours.

Then add the following in order to call your manifest.json file

<link rel="manifest" href="manifest.json">

make sure your website has a favicon. If not, add the following code snippet

<link type="image/x-icon" rel="shortcut icon" href="img/favicon2.ico" type="image/ico" />

Now you need to register your service-worker.js file. Add the following code snippet to your index file or your home file.

<script>
  if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
    console.log("Will the service worker register?");
    navigator.serviceWorker.register('service-worker.js')
      .then(function(reg){
        console.log("Yes, it did.");
      }).catch(function(err) {
        console.log("No it didn't. This happened: ", err)
      });
  }
</script>
<script>
        // Service worker for Progressive Web App
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        navigator.serviceWorker.register('service-worker.js', {
            scope: '.' // THIS IS REQUIRED FOR RUNNING A PROGRESSIVE WEB APP FROM A NON_ROOT PATH
        }).then(function(registration) {
            // Registration was successful
            console.log('ServiceWorker registration successful with scope: ', registration.scope);
        }, function(err) {
            // registration failed :(
            console.log('ServiceWorker registration failed: ', err);
        });
    }
};
</script>

Go back to your website.(mine is https://paradisemodelschool.com.ng). You should see the A2HS(Add-to-Home-Screen) feature pop up in your mobile device browser or click to install at the top right corner in your laptop browser.

View my PWA site at https://paradisemodelschool.com.ng.

BONUS Test your PWA score on https://pwabuilder.com.ng/

If there is any issue kindly drop your message below.

Enjoy!

posts.content:
Have you ever wanted to see that green padlock on your site even when developing a web application on your local server?

Ok! Let`s get our hands dirty....

firstly,

Go to your local server directory...mine is c:/xampp

Move into your Apache folder and create a new folder called crt

Inside the crt folder, create a file called cert.conf and write the following code to the file...

[ req ]

default_bits        = 2048
default_keyfile     = server-key.pem
distinguished_name  = subject
req_extensions      = req_ext
x509_extensions     = x509_ext
string_mask         = utf8only

[ subject ]

countryName                 = Country Name (2 letter code)
countryName_default         = NG

stateOrProvinceName         = State or Province Name (full name)
stateOrProvinceName_default = OG

localityName                = Locality Name (eg, city)
localityName_default        = Ogun State

organizationName            = Organization Name (eg, company)
organizationName_default    = DotEightInc

commonName                  = Common Name (e.g. server FQDN or YOUR name)
commonName_default          = attendplus.com.ng

emailAddress                = Email Address
emailAddress_default        = hello@attendplus.com.ng

[ x509_ext ]

subjectKeyIdentifier   = hash
authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid,issuer

basicConstraints       = CA:FALSE
keyUsage               = digitalSignature, keyEncipherment
subjectAltName         = @alternate_names
nsComment              = "OpenSSL Generated Certificate"

[ req_ext ]

subjectKeyIdentifier = hash

basicConstraints     = CA:FALSE
keyUsage             = digitalSignature, keyEncipherment
subjectAltName       = @alternate_names
nsComment            = "OpenSSL Generated Certificate"

[ alternate_names ]

DNS.1       = attendplus.com.ng

Make sure you change the domain names to the domain name of your choice and provide other details like your country code and others... for mine my domain name that i`ll love to create an SSL is attendplus.com.ng

Next, create a new file and name that file make-cert.bat and copy the following codes to it

@echo off
set /p domain="Enter Domain: "
set OPENSSL_CONF=../conf/openssl.cnf

if not exist .\%domain% mkdir .\%domain%

..\bin\openssl req -config cert.conf -new -sha256 -newkey rsa:2048 -nodes -keyout %domain%\server.key -x509 -days 365 -out %domain%\server.crt

echo.
echo -----
echo The certificate was provided.
echo.
pause

Now open your command prompt as an administrator...make sure you have administrator right, else the next process won`t work...

Type in the folllowing commands on your cmd

cd/

cd xampp/apache/crt/

start make-cert.bat

Provide your domain name and hit enter and enter till the process ends....

Go back to your Xampp directory where your crt folder is. You should notice that a folder was created with your the domain name you inputted....

Next,

Open the newly created folder. You will find two new files

server server.key

double click on the server

a dialog box pops up

follow the below images to continue:

head back to your browser... restart your xampp server and type https://{domain name}

you should see a green padlock on your site...

if this didn`t work out well for you, you might need to re-configure your virtual host

I`ll be releasing an article on that this night...(I ran out of battery power)

ðŸ˜Ž Enjoy!

posts.content:
Holla,ðŸ‘‹ Most times as a developer, I`m always faced with the problem of hidding my file extensions something like thisðŸ‘‡

ok! so, how do I solve this issue...? pretty simpleâœ”

Firstly, go into your file directory and create a new file. Name the file .htaccess and write the following codes to the file

RewriteEngine on 
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME}\.html -f
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ $1.html [NC,L]

RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME}\.php -f
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ $1.php [NC,L]

Now go back to your browser and type a url without the .html or .php like this https://attendplus.com.ng/contact

You should have your web file displayed properly...

Enjoy!ðŸ˜Ž
